first: Tha Forefaithers o Jesus tha Messiah  Here ïs tha femlie line o Jesus Christ, tha sinn o Davit an o Abraham:  Abraham wus tha faither o Isaac, Isaac tha faither o Jacob, Jacob tha faither o Judah an hïs brithers.
second: An Judah wus tha faither o Perez an Zerah, an thair mither wus Tamar.

second: Jesus tha Messiah ïs boarn  An thïs ïs hoo tha birth o Jesus Christ cum aboot: hïs mither Mary wus promist tae Joseph, but afore the' cum thegither, she fun oot she wus wi a wean.

first: Jesus tha Messiah ïs boarn  An thïs ïs hoo tha birth o Jesus Christ cum aboot: hïs mither Mary wus promist tae Joseph, but afore the' cum thegither, she fun oot she wus wi a wean.
second: An ït wus bi tha Halie Spïrit.

first: An ït wus bi tha Halie Spïrit.

first: He wus thïnkin aboot aa thïs, whan lo an behoul, an angel o tha Loard appeart tae hïm ïn a draim an saed, “Joseph, sinn o Davit, dïnnae be feart tae tak Mary fer yer wife, fer tha wean she's cairryin ïs o tha Halie Spïrit.
second: She wull hae a sinn, an ye ir tae gie hïm tha name Jesus, fer he wull save hïs ain fowk frae thair wrangdaeins.” Noo aa thïs wus daen tae brïng aboot whut tha Loard haed saed throu tha proaphit:  “A virgin wull cairrie a wean, a sinn,  an whan he's boarn, he'll be caad Immanuel”  - mainin “God ïs wi iz.”  Whaniver Joseph waakent up, he daen whut tha angel o tha Loard haed toul hïm tae dae, an he tuk Mary hame fer tae be hïs wife.

first: She wull hae a sinn, an ye ir tae gie hïm tha name Jesus, fer he wull save hïs ain fowk frae thair wrangdaeins.” Noo aa thïs wus daen tae brïng aboot whut tha Loard haed saed throu tha proaphit:  “A virgin wull cairrie a wean, a sinn,  an whan he's boarn, he'll be caad Immanuel”  - mainin “God ïs wi iz.”  Whaniver Joseph waakent up, he daen whut tha angel o tha Loard haed toul hïm tae dae, an he tuk Mary hame fer tae be hïs wife.
second: But he dïdnae sleep wi hir til eftèr tha wean wus boarn.

second: Tha spaemen frae tha East  Eftèr Jesus wus boarn ïn Bethlehem ïn Judea, durin tha time that Herod wus Kïng, spaemen frae tha East cum tae Jerusalem an the' axt, “Whar ïs tha yin that haes bin boarn Kïng o tha Jews?

first: Tha spaemen frae tha East  Eftèr Jesus wus boarn ïn Bethlehem ïn Judea, durin tha time that Herod wus Kïng, spaemen frae tha East cum tae Jerusalem an the' axt, “Whar ïs tha yin that haes bin boarn Kïng o tha Jews?
second: Fer we hae saen hïs starn ïn tha East an hae cum fer tae woarship hïm.” Whaniver Kïng Herod heerd thïs, he wus baadlie püt aboot, an aa Jerusalem wi hïm.

first: Fer we hae saen hïs starn ïn tha East an hae cum fer tae woarship hïm.” Whaniver Kïng Herod heerd thïs, he wus baadlie püt aboot, an aa Jerusalem wi hïm.
second: Sae he brocht thegither aa tha Jewish fowk's heid preeshts an maistèrs o tha Laa, an he axt thaim whar tha Christ wus tae be boarn.

first: Sae he brocht thegither aa tha Jewish fowk's heid preeshts an maistèrs o tha Laa, an he axt thaim whar tha Christ wus tae be boarn.
second: In Bethlehem o Judea,” the' saed, “fer thïs ïs whut tha proaphit writ: ‘But you, Bethlehem, ïn tha lan o Judah, ye ir bi nae mains tha laist amang tha rulers o Judah; fer oot o you wull cum a ruler that wull herd ma fowk Israel.’ ”  Then Herod caad tha wise men thegither on tha quait, an he fun oot frae thaim whan ït wus that tha starn haed cum ïntae sicht.

first: In Bethlehem o Judea,” the' saed, “fer thïs ïs whut tha proaphit writ: ‘But you, Bethlehem, ïn tha lan o Judah, ye ir bi nae mains tha laist amang tha rulers o Judah; fer oot o you wull cum a ruler that wull herd ma fowk Israel.’ ”  Then Herod caad tha wise men thegither on tha quait, an he fun oot frae thaim whan ït wus that tha starn haed cum ïntae sicht.
second: He sent thaim tae Bethlehem an he toul thaim, “Luk ïn iverie airt fer tha wean.

first: He sent thaim tae Bethlehem an he toul thaim, “Luk ïn iverie airt fer tha wean.

first: As shuin as yis fin hïm, wud ye brïng me wurd, sae as A can gae an woarship hïm as weel!” Eftèr the' haed heerd whut tha kïng haed tae say, the' set aff on thair wye, an lo an behoul, tha starn the' haed saen ïn tha East went aheid o thaim, til ït stapt richt ower tha place whar tha wean wus.
second: Whaniver the' saa tha starn, the' wur hairt gled.

second: Jhone tha Baptiser maks tha wye readie fer Jesus  In thaim days Jhone tha Baptiser cum praichin ïn tha wiles o Judea an sayin, “Turn awa frae yer sïns, fer tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs nearhan.” Jhone ïs tha yin tha proaphit Isaiah spauk aboot, tellin: “Thair's a voice cryin oot ïn tha wiles, ‘Mak tha wye readie fer tha Loard, mak hïs pads strecht fer hïm!’ ” Jhone's claes wus made o kemel's hair, an he haed a leather belt roon hïs mïddle.

first: Jhone tha Baptiser maks tha wye readie fer Jesus  In thaim days Jhone tha Baptiser cum praichin ïn tha wiles o Judea an sayin, “Turn awa frae yer sïns, fer tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs nearhan.” Jhone ïs tha yin tha proaphit Isaiah spauk aboot, tellin: “Thair's a voice cryin oot ïn tha wiles, ‘Mak tha wye readie fer tha Loard, mak hïs pads strecht fer hïm!’ ” Jhone's claes wus made o kemel's hair, an he haed a leather belt roon hïs mïddle.

second: An eftèr leain Nazareth, he gaed tae Capernaum an he stapt thair.

first: An eftèr leain Nazareth, he gaed tae Capernaum an he stapt thair.
second: Capernaum wus bi tha Loch ïn tha dïstrict o Zebulun an Naphtali -- tae brïng aboot whut wus foretoul bi tha proaphit Isaiah:  “In tha lan o Zebulun an tha lan o Naphtali,  on tha wye tae tha Loch, on tha ither side o tha Joardan,  ïn Galilee whar tha Gentiles leeve -  tha fowk that sut ïn tha dairk  hae saa a bricht licht;  an on tha yins leevin ïn tha lan o tha shedda o deith,  tha licht haes cum ïn.”  Frae then on Jesus begun tae praich, “Turn awa frae yer sïns, fer tha Kïngdom o Heiven haes cum nearhan ye.”  Jesus' furst follaers  Yin day, whan Jesus wus waakin alang tha loch shore o Galilee, he saa twa brithers, Simon caad Petèr an hïs brither Andra.

first: Capernaum wus bi tha Loch ïn tha dïstrict o Zebulun an Naphtali -- tae brïng aboot whut wus foretoul bi tha proaphit Isaiah:  “In tha lan o Zebulun an tha lan o Naphtali,  on tha wye tae tha Loch, on tha ither side o tha Joardan,  ïn Galilee whar tha Gentiles leeve -  tha fowk that sut ïn tha dairk  hae saa a bricht licht;  an on tha yins leevin ïn tha lan o tha shedda o deith,  tha licht haes cum ïn.”  Frae then on Jesus begun tae praich, “Turn awa frae yer sïns, fer tha Kïngdom o Heiven haes cum nearhan ye.”  Jesus' furst follaers  Yin day, whan Jesus wus waakin alang tha loch shore o Galilee, he saa twa brithers, Simon caad Petèr an hïs brither Andra.
second: The' wur castin a neyt ïntae tha wattèr, fer the' wrocht at tha fïshin.

first: The' wur castin a neyt ïntae tha wattèr, fer the' wrocht at tha fïshin.
second: Cum an follae me,” Jesus saed, “an A wull mak ye fïshers o men.” An richt awa the' layed doon thair neyts an the' follaed eftèr hïm.

first: Cum an follae me,” Jesus saed, “an A wull mak ye fïshers o men.” An richt awa the' layed doon thair neyts an the' follaed eftèr hïm.
second: He gan on frae thair, an saen twa ither brithers, Jeames tha sinn o Zebedee an hïs brither Jhone.

first: He gan on frae thair, an saen twa ither brithers, Jeames tha sinn o Zebedee an hïs brither Jhone.
second: The' wur ïn a bóat wi thair faither Zebedee, mennin thair neyts.

first: The' wur ïn a bóat wi thair faither Zebedee, mennin thair neyts.
second: Jesus caad thaim, an richt awa the' left tha bóat an thair faither, an the' follaed hïm.

first: Jesus caad thaim, an richt awa the' left tha bóat an thair faither, an the' follaed hïm.
second: Jesus maks aa kines o seeck fowk bettèr  Jesus trevelt aa roon Galilee, taichin ïn thair Meetin Hooses, an praichin tha Guid Wittins o tha Kïngdom, an curin iverie disaise an ailment amang tha fowk.

first: Jesus maks aa kines o seeck fowk bettèr  Jesus trevelt aa roon Galilee, taichin ïn thair Meetin Hooses, an praichin tha Guid Wittins o tha Kïngdom, an curin iverie disaise an ailment amang tha fowk.
second: Wurd aboot hïm spreed aa ower Syria, an the' brocht tae hïm aa tha seeck fowk wi aa kines o disaises: thaim that wus tormentit, or bothert wi ïll spïrits, or tuk fïts, or fowk that wus paralysed, an he made thaim bettèr.

first: Wurd aboot hïm spreed aa ower Syria, an the' brocht tae hïm aa tha seeck fowk wi aa kines o disaises: thaim that wus tormentit, or bothert wi ïll spïrits, or tuk fïts, or fowk that wus paralysed, an he made thaim bettèr.
second: Bïg croods follaed hïm frae Galilee, an tha Ten Toons, an Jerusalem, an Judea an tha dïstrict on tha ither side o tha rïver Joardan.

first: Bïg croods follaed hïm frae Galilee, an tha Ten Toons, an Jerusalem, an Judea an tha dïstrict on tha ither side o tha rïver Joardan.
second: Jesus taiches on tha muntin  Noo whaniver he saa tha croods, he gaed up tha muntin an sut doon.

first: Jesus taiches on tha muntin  Noo whaniver he saa tha croods, he gaed up tha muntin an sut doon.
second: Hïs follaers gethert roon hïm, an he stairtit tae taich thaim, sayin,  Tha Blissins  “Blisst ir tha puir ïn spïrit, fer thairs ïs tha Kïngdom o Heiven.

first: Hïs follaers gethert roon hïm, an he stairtit tae taich thaim, sayin,  Tha Blissins  “Blisst ir tha puir ïn spïrit, fer thairs ïs tha Kïngdom o Heiven.
second: Blisst ir tha yins that greet, fer the' wull be comfortit.

first: Blisst ir tha yins that greet, fer the' wull be comfortit.
second: Blisst ir tha yins that ir gentle, fer the' wull inherit tha irth.

first: Blisst ir tha yins that ir gentle, fer the' wull inherit tha irth.
second: Blisst ir tha yins that hae a hung'r an a druith fer whut's richt, fer the' wull get thair fïll.

first: Blisst ir tha yins that hae a hung'r an a druith fer whut's richt, fer the' wull get thair fïll.
second: Blisst ir tha yins that ir merciefu, fer the' wull be showed mercie.

first: Blisst ir tha yins that ir merciefu, fer the' wull be showed mercie.
second: Blisst ir tha pure ïn hairt, fer the' wull see God.

first: Blisst ir tha pure ïn hairt, fer the' wull see God.
second: Blisst ir tha yins that warks fer peace, fer the' wull be caad sinns o God.

first: Blisst ir tha yins that warks fer peace, fer the' wull be caad sinns o God.
second: Blisst ir tha yins that's traitit ïll fer daein whut's richt, fer thairs ïs tha Kïngdom o Heiven.

first: Blisst ir tha yins that's traitit ïll fer daein whut's richt, fer thairs ïs tha Kïngdom o Heiven.
second: Blisst ir you whan fowks baadmooth ye, an trait ye ïll, an miscaa ye on accoont o me.

first: Blisst ir you whan fowks baadmooth ye, an trait ye ïll, an miscaa ye on accoont o me.
second: Be joyfu an gled, acause yis hae a pooerfu reward waitin fer ye ïn heiven, fer the' ïll-traitit tha proaphits that wus thair afore ye ïn jist tha same wye.

first: Be joyfu an gled, acause yis hae a pooerfu reward waitin fer ye ïn heiven, fer the' ïll-traitit tha proaphits that wus thair afore ye ïn jist tha same wye.
second: Saut an licht  Yous ir tha saut o tha irth.

first: Saut an licht  Yous ir tha saut o tha irth.
second: But ïf tha saut loasses ïts taste, hoo can ït git bak ïts tang?

first: But ïf tha saut loasses ïts taste, hoo can ït git bak ïts tang?
second: It ïs nae lang'r onie use, but fer tae be throwed oot an thrampt unnèr fit.

first: It ïs nae lang'r onie use, but fer tae be throwed oot an thrampt unnèr fit.
second: Yous ir tha licht o tha warl.

first: Yous ir tha licht o tha warl.
second: A toon bigged on a hïll cannae be hïd.

first: A toon bigged on a hïll cannae be hïd.
second: Ye dïnnae licht a lamp an pit ït unnèr a boul.

first: Ye dïnnae licht a lamp an pit ït unnèr a boul.
second: Na, ye pit ït on a stan, whar ït gies licht tae tha hale hoose.

first: Na, ye pit ït on a stan, whar ït gies licht tae tha hale hoose.
second: In tha same wye, let yer licht shine afore iveriebodie, sae as the' wull see yer guid warks an gie glorie tae yer Faither ïn heiven.

first: In tha same wye, let yer licht shine afore iveriebodie, sae as the' wull see yer guid warks an gie glorie tae yer Faither ïn heiven.
second: Aboot tha Laa  Dïnnae be thïnkin that A hae cum fer tae dae awa wi tha Laa or tha Proaphits; A hinnae cum fer tae dae awa wi thaim, but fer tae fülfill thaim.

first: Aboot tha Laa  Dïnnae be thïnkin that A hae cum fer tae dae awa wi tha Laa or tha Proaphits; A hinnae cum fer tae dae awa wi thaim, but fer tae fülfill thaim.
second: A tell ye tha truith, afore heiven an irth passes awa, no tha weeest lettèr, ner even tha weeest stroke o a pen, wull pass awa frae tha Laa afore iveriethin God wants fer ït ïs brocht aboot.

first: A tell ye tha truith, afore heiven an irth passes awa, no tha weeest lettèr, ner even tha weeest stroke o a pen, wull pass awa frae tha Laa afore iveriethin God wants fer ït ïs brocht aboot.
second: Oniebodie that breks yin o these commauns, even tha laist o thaim, an lairns ithers tae dae tha same, wull be laist thocht o ïn tha Kïngdom o Heiven, but whaiver keeps these commauns an lairns ithers tae dae thaim, wull be gye weel thocht o ïn tha Kïngdom o Heiven.

first: Oniebodie that breks yin o these commauns, even tha laist o thaim, an lairns ithers tae dae tha same, wull be laist thocht o ïn tha Kïngdom o Heiven, but whaiver keeps these commauns an lairns ithers tae dae thaim, wull be gye weel thocht o ïn tha Kïngdom o Heiven.
second: Fer A'm tellin yis thïs: less yer guidness gaes beyont that o tha Pharisees an tha maistèrs o tha Laa, yis'll no git ïntae tha Kïngdom o Heiven, that's fer shair!

first: Fer A'm tellin yis thïs: less yer guidness gaes beyont that o tha Pharisees an tha maistèrs o tha Laa, yis'll no git ïntae tha Kïngdom o Heiven, that's fer shair!
second: Aboot ang'r  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed tae fowk lang syne, ‘Dïnnae commït murdèr, an oniebodie that murdèrs wull be judged fer ït.’ But A'm tellin ye, oniebodie that's even ang'rie wi hïs brither [wioot onie caas] ïs gaun tae be judged fer ït.

first: Aboot ang'r  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed tae fowk lang syne, ‘Dïnnae commït murdèr, an oniebodie that murdèrs wull be judged fer ït.’ But A'm tellin ye, oniebodie that's even ang'rie wi hïs brither [wioot onie caas] ïs gaun tae be judged fer ït.
second: Agane, oniebodie that says tae hïs brither, ‘Ye eejit ye!’ - that bodie wull hae tha Heich Cooncil tae answer tae.

first: Agane, oniebodie that says tae hïs brither, ‘Ye eejit ye!’ - that bodie wull hae tha Heich Cooncil tae answer tae.
second: An oniebodie that says, ‘Ye oul fool!’ wull be rinnin tha risk o hell fire.

first: An oniebodie that says, ‘Ye oul fool!’ wull be rinnin tha risk o hell fire.
second: Sae, ïf ye ir brïngin yer offerin tae tha althar, an ye mine that yer brither haes ocht agin ye, jist lea ït doon fornent tha althar.

first: Sae, ïf ye ir brïngin yer offerin tae tha althar, an ye mine that yer brither haes ocht agin ye, jist lea ït doon fornent tha althar.
second: Awa an mak ït up wi yer brither furst; then cum bak an gie yer offerin ïn.

first: Awa an mak ït up wi yer brither furst; then cum bak an gie yer offerin ïn.
second: Soart thïngs oot quïck wi yer enemie that ïs takkin ye tae coort.

first: Soart thïngs oot quïck wi yer enemie that ïs takkin ye tae coort.
second: Dae ït while ye ir still wi hïm on tha wye thair, or he'll mebbe han ye ower tae tha judge, an tha judge cud han ye ower tae tha offysher, an ye cud be cloddit ïntae jail.

first: Dae ït while ye ir still wi hïm on tha wye thair, or he'll mebbe han ye ower tae tha judge, an tha judge cud han ye ower tae tha offysher, an ye cud be cloddit ïntae jail.
second: A tell ye tha truith, ye'll no git oot o thair afore yer last pennie's pyed!

first: A tell ye tha truith, ye'll no git oot o thair afore yer last pennie's pyed!
second: Aboot adultèrie  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed, ‘Dïnnae commït adultèrie.’ But A'm tellin yis that oniebodie that even luks at a wumman wi lust haes aareadie commïtit adultèrie wi hir ïn hïs hairt.

first: Aboot adultèrie  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed, ‘Dïnnae commït adultèrie.’ But A'm tellin yis that oniebodie that even luks at a wumman wi lust haes aareadie commïtit adultèrie wi hir ïn hïs hairt.
second: If yer richt ee maks ye dae wrang, hoke ït oot an clod ït awa.

first: If yer richt ee maks ye dae wrang, hoke ït oot an clod ït awa.
second: It's faur bettèr fer ye tae loass tha yin pairt o yer bodie ner fer yer hale bodie tae be throwed ïntae hell.

first: It's faur bettèr fer ye tae loass tha yin pairt o yer bodie ner fer yer hale bodie tae be throwed ïntae hell.
second: An ïf yer richt han maks ye dae wrang, cut ït aff an clod ït awa.

first: An ïf yer richt han maks ye dae wrang, cut ït aff an clod ït awa.
second: It's faur bettèr fer ye tae loass tha yin pairt o yer bodie ner fer yer hale bodie tae gang ïntae hell.

first: It's faur bettèr fer ye tae loass tha yin pairt o yer bodie ner fer yer hale bodie tae gang ïntae hell.
second: Aboot divorce  It's bin saed ïn tha Scrïptures as weel: ‘Oniebodie that divorces hïs guidwife maun gie hir a notysh o divorce.’ But A'm tellin ye that oniebodie that pits awa hïs wife - fer ocht ither ner rinnin aff wi anither man - he maks hir an adultèress; an oniebodie that merries a divorced wumman commïts adultèrie as weel.

first: Aboot divorce  It's bin saed ïn tha Scrïptures as weel: ‘Oniebodie that divorces hïs guidwife maun gie hir a notysh o divorce.’ But A'm tellin ye that oniebodie that pits awa hïs wife - fer ocht ither ner rinnin aff wi anither man - he maks hir an adultèress; an oniebodie that merries a divorced wumman commïts adultèrie as weel.
second: Aboot oaths  Forbye, ye ken that ït wus saed tae tha fowk lang syne, ‘Dïnnae brek yer oath, but keep tha oaths ye hae made tae tha Loard.’ A'm tellin ye but, dïnnae sweer ava: ether bi heiven, fer ït ïs God's throne; or bi tha irth, fer ït ïs hïs fit-creepie; or bi Jerusalem, fer ït ïs tha cïtie o tha michtie Kïng.

first: Aboot oaths  Forbye, ye ken that ït wus saed tae tha fowk lang syne, ‘Dïnnae brek yer oath, but keep tha oaths ye hae made tae tha Loard.’ A'm tellin ye but, dïnnae sweer ava: ether bi heiven, fer ït ïs God's throne; or bi tha irth, fer ït ïs hïs fit-creepie; or bi Jerusalem, fer ït ïs tha cïtie o tha michtie Kïng.
second: An dïnnae sweer bi yer heid, fer ye cannae mak even yin o yer hairs white or blek.

first: An dïnnae sweer bi yer heid, fer ye cannae mak even yin o yer hairs white or blek.
second: Jist let yer ‘Ay’ be ‘Ay’, an yer ‘Na’, ‘Na’; oniethin mair ner thïs cums frae tha wïckit yin.

first: Jist let yer ‘Ay’ be ‘Ay’, an yer ‘Na’, ‘Na’; oniethin mair ner thïs cums frae tha wïckit yin.
second: An ee fer an ee  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed, ‘An ee fer an ee, an a tuith fer a tuith.’ But A tell ye, Dïnnae fecht agin a wïckit bodie!

first: An ee fer an ee  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed, ‘An ee fer an ee, an a tuith fer a tuith.’ But A tell ye, Dïnnae fecht agin a wïckit bodie!
second: If summodie hïts ye on tha richt cheek, turn tha ither side til hïm forbye.

first: If summodie hïts ye on tha richt cheek, turn tha ither side til hïm forbye.
second: An ïf summodie wants tae sue ye an tak tha shirt aff yer bak, let hïm hae yer tap-cóat as weel.

first: An ïf summodie wants tae sue ye an tak tha shirt aff yer bak, let hïm hae yer tap-cóat as weel.
second: If summodie gars ye tae gang yin mile, gang twa mile wi hïm.

first: If summodie gars ye tae gang yin mile, gang twa mile wi hïm.
second: Gie tae tha yin that axes ye fer ocht, an dïnnae turn yer bak on a bodie that's lukkin tha lenn o sumthin.

first: Gie tae tha yin that axes ye fer ocht, an dïnnae turn yer bak on a bodie that's lukkin tha lenn o sumthin.
second: Love fer yer enemies  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed, ‘Love yer nighber an hait yer enemie.’ But A tell ye: Love yer enemies an pray fer thaim that traits ye ïll, that ye micht be childèr o yer Faither ïn heiven.

first: Love fer yer enemies  Yis hae heerd that ït wus saed, ‘Love yer nighber an hait yer enemie.’ But A tell ye: Love yer enemies an pray fer thaim that traits ye ïll, that ye micht be childèr o yer Faither ïn heiven.
second: He maks hïs sin tae rise on tha wïckit as weel as on tha guid, an he senns rain on thaim that daes whut's richt, as weel as on tha yins that daesnae.

first: He maks hïs sin tae rise on tha wïckit as weel as on tha guid, an he senns rain on thaim that daes whut's richt, as weel as on tha yins that daesnae.
second: If ye jist love thaim at loves you, whut reward wull ye get?

first: If ye jist love thaim at loves you, whut reward wull ye get?
second: Shair even tha tex men daes that!

first: Shair even tha tex men daes that!
second: An ïf ye onlie pass tha time o day wi yer ain yins, whut ir ye daein mair ner ithers?

first: An ïf ye onlie pass tha time o day wi yer ain yins, whut ir ye daein mair ner ithers?
second: Even pagans daes tha same, dae the' no?

first: Even pagans daes tha same, dae the' no?
second: Giein tae tha needie  “Dïnnae mak a show afore fowk o onie guid yis dae, fer yer Faither ïn heiven wull gie yis nae reward fer that.

first: Giein tae tha needie  “Dïnnae mak a show afore fowk o onie guid yis dae, fer yer Faither ïn heiven wull gie yis nae reward fer that.
second: Sae, whan ye gie ocht tae tha needie, dïnnae soon tha trumpet, tha wye tha hippycrates daes ïn tha Meetin Hooses an on tha streets, fer tae be weel thocht o.

first: Sae, whan ye gie ocht tae tha needie, dïnnae soon tha trumpet, tha wye tha hippycrates daes ïn tha Meetin Hooses an on tha streets, fer tae be weel thocht o.
second: A tell ye tha truith, the' hae got aa tha reward the'ir gaun tae get.

first: A tell ye tha truith, the' hae got aa tha reward the'ir gaun tae get.
second: But whan ye gie ocht tae tha needie, dïnnae let yer left han ken whut yer richt han ïs daein, sae that yer giein micht be on tha quait.

first: But whan ye gie ocht tae tha needie, dïnnae let yer left han ken whut yer richt han ïs daein, sae that yer giein micht be on tha quait.
second: Then yer Faither, that sees whut ïs daen on tha quait, wull reward ye.

first: Then yer Faither, that sees whut ïs daen on tha quait, wull reward ye.
second: Prayer an fastin  An whan yis pray, dïnnae be laik tha hippycrates, fer the' love tae stan an pray ïn tha Meetin Hooses an on tha street coarners fer aa tae see.

first: Prayer an fastin  An whan yis pray, dïnnae be laik tha hippycrates, fer the' love tae stan an pray ïn tha Meetin Hooses an on tha street coarners fer aa tae see.
second: A tell ye tha truith, the' hae got aa the'ir gaun tae get.

first: A tell ye tha truith, the' hae got aa the'ir gaun tae get.
second: But whan you pray, gang awa ïntae a ruim alane, shut tha dure an pray tae yer Faither ïn saicret.

first: But whan you pray, gang awa ïntae a ruim alane, shut tha dure an pray tae yer Faither ïn saicret.
second: Then yer Faither at sees whut ïs daen ïn saicret, wull reward ye.

first: Then yer Faither at sees whut ïs daen ïn saicret, wull reward ye.
second: An whan ye pray, dïnnae keep rhymin on an on laik pagans, fer they thïnk tha mair the' taak, tha bettèr the' wull be heerd.

first: An whan ye pray, dïnnae keep rhymin on an on laik pagans, fer they thïnk tha mair the' taak, tha bettèr the' wull be heerd.
second: Dïnnae be laik thaim, fer yer Faither kens whut ye hae need o afore ye ax hïm.

first: Dïnnae be laik thaim, fer yer Faither kens whut ye hae need o afore ye ax hïm.
second: Sae thïs ïs hoo ye shud pray:  ‘Oor Faither that bides Abain,  Halie be yer name.

first: Sae thïs ïs hoo ye shud pray:  ‘Oor Faither that bides Abain,  Halie be yer name.
second: Micht yer Kïngdom cum shuin,  An yer wull be daen on irth  Jist tha wye ït ïs Abain.

first: Micht yer Kïngdom cum shuin,  An yer wull be daen on irth  Jist tha wye ït ïs Abain.
second: Gie iz theday eneuch breid tae dae iz.

first: Gie iz theday eneuch breid tae dae iz.
second: An forgie iz oor debts,  jist as we hae forgien tha yins that's ïn debt tae us.

first: An forgie iz oor debts,  jist as we hae forgien tha yins that's ïn debt tae us.
second: An dïnnae róad iz ïntae temptation,  but save iz frae tha wïckit yin,  [fer yours ïs tha Kïngdom,  tha pooer an tha glorie,  fer iver an iver, Amen.]’  Fer ïf you forgie fowk whan the' dae wrang agin ye, then yer heivenlie Faither wull forgie you as weel.

first: An dïnnae róad iz ïntae temptation,  but save iz frae tha wïckit yin,  [fer yours ïs tha Kïngdom,  tha pooer an tha glorie,  fer iver an iver, Amen.]’  Fer ïf you forgie fowk whan the' dae wrang agin ye, then yer heivenlie Faither wull forgie you as weel.
second: But ïf ye dïnnae forgie fowk thair wrangdaeins, yer Faither wull no forgie you tha wrangs yous hae daen.

first: But ïf ye dïnnae forgie fowk thair wrangdaeins, yer Faither wull no forgie you tha wrangs yous hae daen.
second: Whan ye fast, dïnnae luk doon In tha mooth as tha hippycrates dae, fer the' mak thair faces luk mïserable jist tae let fowk see the'r fastin.

first: Hae ye cum here tae torment iz afore tha day o Reckonin?” A bït awa frae thaim, a bïg herd o pïgs wus hokin fer food.

second: Tha yins lukkin eftèr tha pïgs run aff; the' gaed ïntae tha toon an toul iveriebodie aa that haed tuk place, an whut haed happent tae tha men bothert wi ïll spïrits.

second: Then tha hale toon gaed oot tae meet Jesus.

first: Then tha hale toon gaed oot tae meet Jesus.

first: An whan the' saen hïm, the' plaidit wi hïm tae lea thair pairt o tha kintrie.

first: A paralysed man made bettèr  Jesus climmed ïntae a bóat, sailed ower tha ither side an cum tae hïs ain toon.
second: The' brocht a paralysed man tae hïm, lyin on a bed.

first: Is ït aisier tae say, ‘Yer sïns ïs forgien ye,’ or tae say, ‘Get up an waak’?

first: A while latèr, whan Jesus wus at a dennèr at Mattha's hoose, thair wus a hale lock o tex men an ither fowk o ïll repute aitin alang wi hïm an hïs follaers.
second: Whaniver tha Pharisees saen thïs, the' axt hïs follaers, “Whut's yer maistèr daein aitin wi thaim tex men an sïnners?” On hearin thïs, Jesus saed, “It ïs no thaim that's weel needs a doctèr, but thaim that's seeck.

first: Whaniver tha Pharisees saen thïs, the' axt hïs follaers, “Whut's yer maistèr daein aitin wi thaim tex men an sïnners?” On hearin thïs, Jesus saed, “It ïs no thaim that's weel needs a doctèr, but thaim that's seeck.

second: Thair'll cum a day but, whaniver tha bridegruim wull be tuk awa frae thaim; an ït's then the'll be fastin.

first: Noo whan Jesus cum tae tha hame o tha heidyin o tha Meetin Hoose, he saa tha funèral flutèrs an aa tha hale thrang foofin an greetin, an he saed, “Awa er that!
second: Tha wee lass ïs no deid, she's jist sleepin.” But the' begun tae lach at hïm.

first: Tha wee lass ïs no deid, she's jist sleepin.” But the' begun tae lach at hïm.

second: Twa blin men  As Jesus gaed on frae thair, twa blin men follaed hïm, caain oot, “Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on iz!” Whaniver he went ïntae hïs hoose, tha blin men cum ïn tae, an he axt thaim, “Dae yis believe A hae tha pooer fer tae dae whut ye'r wantin?” “Ay, Loard,” the' saed, “we dae.” Then he toucht thair een an saed, “It'll be daen tae ye, accoardin tae yer faith.” An thair sicht cum bak, an the' cud see!

first: Twa blin men  As Jesus gaed on frae thair, twa blin men follaed hïm, caain oot, “Sinn o Davit, tak peetie on iz!” Whaniver he went ïntae hïs hoose, tha blin men cum ïn tae, an he axt thaim, “Dae yis believe A hae tha pooer fer tae dae whut ye'r wantin?” “Ay, Loard,” the' saed, “we dae.” Then he toucht thair een an saed, “It'll be daen tae ye, accoardin tae yer faith.” An thair sicht cum bak, an the' cud see!
second: Jesus gien thaim a guid warnin an saed, “Luk here, dïnnae you be tellin oniebodie aboot thïs.” But nae shuiner wur the' oot, than the' stairtit tae spreed tha news aboot hïm aa roon tha hale kintrie.

first: Jesus gien thaim a guid warnin an saed, “Luk here, dïnnae you be tellin oniebodie aboot thïs.” But nae shuiner wur the' oot, than the' stairtit tae spreed tha news aboot hïm aa roon tha hale kintrie.
second: An eftèr the' left, a man that wus bothert wi ïll spïrits an cudnae spake wus brocht tae Jesus.

first: Tha crood o fowk wus dumfoonèrt an saed, “We niver saen tha laiks o thïs ïn Israel afore!” But tha Pharisees saed, “It's tha Deil, tha heidyin o tha ïll spïrits that gies hïm tha pooer tae cast oot ïll spïrits!”  A gran hairst ïs waitin  An Jesus trevelt throu aa tha toons an vïllages, taichin ïn thair Meetin Hooses, praichin tha Guid News o tha Kïngdom, an hailin iverie kine o disaise an ailment.
second: Whaniver he saen tha croods, hïs hairt went oot tae thaim, acause the' wur aa laik sheep wi nae shepherd: troublet, on thair lane, wi nae róad tae turn.

second: An Jesus sent oot tha twal o thaim an gien thaim thair oardèrs: “Dïnnae be gaun amang tha Gentiles or ïntae onie toon o tha Samaritans.

first: But rether gae tae tha loast sheep o Israel.

first: An as ye ir gaun alang, praich thïs: ‘Tha Kïngdom o Heiven ïs nearhan.’ Heal seeck fowk, rise tha deid, cleanse thaim wi leprosie, drive oot ïll spïrits.

first: Ye hae freelie received, sae ye maun gie freelie.

first: Dïnnae tak alang onie gowld or siller, ner e'en a copper ïn yer girthpooch; tak nae baag fer tha róad, ner spare claes, ner shune ner a stav; fer tha warker ïs warth hïs keep.

first: Whutiver toon or vïllage ye gae ïntae, luk fer some warthie dacent bodie thair an stap ower at hïs hoose til ye tak yer lave o tha place.

first: As ye gae ïntae thïs hame or that, bïd thaim tha time o day.

first: A'm sennin yis oot laik sheep amang wolfs.
second: Sae be as cannie as sarpents an as hairmless as doos.

first: Sae be as cannie as sarpents an as hairmless as doos.

first: On accoont o me, ye'll be brocht afore guviners an kïngs as wutnesses tae thaim an tae tha Gentiles.

first: But whaniver yis ir lïftit an brocht tae thrial, dïnnae be ower enxious aboot whut tae say or hoo tae say ït.

first: Ye'll be gien tha richt wurds at tha richt time.

first: Fer ït'll no be you that's spakin, but tha Spïrit o yer Faither spakin throu ye.

first: Ye'll be haitit bi yin an aa on accoont o me, but he that tholes tae tha enn wull be saved.
second: Whan yis ir persecutit ïn yin place, fly tae anither.

first: Whan yis ir persecutit ïn yin place, fly tae anither.
second: A tell ye tha truith, ye'll no hae feenished gaun throu aa tha toons o Israel afore tha Sinn o Man cums bak!

first: A tell ye tha truith, ye'll no hae feenished gaun throu aa tha toons o Israel afore tha Sinn o Man cums bak!
second: A follaer ïs no abain hïs taicher, ner a sarvint abain hïs maistèr.

first: A follaer ïs no abain hïs taicher, ner a sarvint abain hïs maistèr.

first: Whut mair can tha follaer ax than tae be laik hïs taicher, or tha sarvint tae be laik hïs maistèr?

first: Gin the' hae caad tha heid o tha hoose Beelzebul, weel, whut wull the' no caa aa tha yins o hïs hoosehold!
second: Sae dïnnae be afeart o thaim.

first: Sae dïnnae be afeart o thaim.
second: Thair's naethin covert ower that'll no cum tae licht, ner hïd that'll no be kent.

first: Thair's naethin covert ower that'll no cum tae licht, ner hïd that'll no be kent.

second: Dïnnae be feart o thaim that kïll tha bodie but cannae kïll tha sowl.

first: Rether, be afeart o tha Yin that can desthroy baith bodie an sowl ïn hell.
second: Ir twa wee sparras no soul fer a pennie?

first: Ir twa wee sparras no soul fer a pennie?
second: Yit no yin o thaim wull faa tae tha grun wioot yer Faither knowin ït.

first: Yit no yin o thaim wull faa tae tha grun wioot yer Faither knowin ït.
second: Fer tha verie hairs o yer heid ir aa coontit.

first: Fer tha verie hairs o yer heid ir aa coontit.
second: Sae dïnnae be feart; yis ir warth mair ner a hale wheen o sparras.

first: Sae dïnnae be feart; yis ir warth mair ner a hale wheen o sparras.
second: Whaiver's no feart tae own me afore men, A wull own hïm tae afore ma Faither ïn heiven.

first: Whaiver's no feart tae own me afore men, A wull own hïm tae afore ma Faither ïn heiven.
second: But whaiver disowns me afore men, A wull disown hïm afore ma Faither ïn heiven.

first: But whaiver disowns me afore men, A wull disown hïm afore ma Faither ïn heiven.
second: Dïnnae be thïnkin A hae cum tae brïng peace tae tha irth.

first: Dïnnae be thïnkin A hae cum tae brïng peace tae tha irth.
second: Na, A dïdnae cum tae brïng peace, but a sword.

first: Lïsten then tae whut tha parable o tha sower mains: Whan oniebodie hears tha message aboot tha Kïngdom an daesnae unnèrstan ït, alang cums tha Wïckit Yin an snaps awa whut wus sowed ïn hïs hairt.

second: That's tha raison he haes these mïraclis pooers.” Noo afore thïs, Herod haed tuk houl o Jhone, an he haed hïm tyed up an püt awa ïn jail acause o Herodias, hïs brither Phïlip's wife, fer Jhone wus aye tellin hïm, “Tha Laa daesnae alloo ye tae hae hir!” Herod wud hae kïllt Jhone, but he wus afeart o tha crood turnin on hïm, acause the' lukt on Jhone as a proaphit.

first: Some Pharisees cum up tae hïm, an tae pit hïm tae tha test the' axt hïm, “Is a man allooed tae pit awa hïs wife fer onie an iverie raison?” “Hae ye no read,” Jesus answert, “that richt frae tha stairt tha Creator ‘made men an he made weemen,’ an that he saed, ‘Fer thïs raison a man wull lea hïs faither an hïs mither an be joint tae hïs wife, an tha twa wull becum as yin’?

first: An thair wus a hale thrang o fowk gethert, tha maist o thaim spreedin thair claes on tha róad, while ithers sneddit brenches aff tha trees, an the' strewed thaim on tha pad fer hïm tae ride ower.
second: Tha croods that gan aheid o hïm an thaim that follaed behin cryed oot, “Hosanna tae tha Sinn o Davit!” “Blisst be tha Yin that cums ïn tha name o tha Loard!” “Hosanna ïn tha heichest heiven!” Whaniver Jesus went ïntae Jerusalem, tha hale cïtie wus ïn a stïr an the' axt, “Wha wud thïs man be?” An tha croods saed bak tae thaim, “Thïs ïs Jesus, tha proaphit frae Nazareth ïn Galilee.”  Reddin oot tha dailers  Jesus went ïntae tha Hoose o God an driv oot aa tha dailers that wus buyin an sellin ïn tha coortyaird.

first: Noo then, at tha risin frae tha deid, whase guidwife wull she be o tha seiven, seein she wus merriet tae thaim aa?”  Jesus answert, “Ye ir no richt ava, fer ye dïnnae ken tha Scrïptures an ye dïnnae ken tha pooer o God!
second: At tha risin frae tha deid, thair wull be nae mair merryin; fer whaniver the' dee, fowk wull be laik tha angels [o God] ïn heiven.

first: At tha risin frae tha deid, thair wull be nae mair merryin; fer whaniver the' dee, fowk wull be laik tha angels [o God] ïn heiven.

first: But consarnin tha risin frae tha deid, dae yis no mine readin whut God saed tae ye: ‘A be tha God o Abraham, tha God o Isaac, an tha God o Jacob’?
second: He's no tha God o tha deid; he's tha God o tha leevin.” Whaniver tha croods heerd thïs, the' wur stoondit at hïs taichin.

first: He's no tha God o tha deid; he's tha God o tha leevin.” Whaniver tha croods heerd thïs, the' wur stoondit at hïs taichin.
second: Tha maist impoartin commaun  Hearin that Jesus haed left tha Sadducees wi naethin tae say, tha Pharisees got thegither.

second: An yin o thaim, a thortie on tha Laa, tried tae ketch hïm oot wi thïs question: “Maistèr, whut's tha maist impoartin commaun ïn tha Laa?” Jesus saed, “ ‘Ye maun love tha Loard yer God wi aa yer hairt an wi aa yer sowl an wi aa yer mine.’ Thïs ïs tha furst an tha maist impoartin commaun.

first: An yin o thaim, a thortie on tha Laa, tried tae ketch hïm oot wi thïs question: “Maistèr, whut's tha maist impoartin commaun ïn tha Laa?” Jesus saed, “ ‘Ye maun love tha Loard yer God wi aa yer hairt an wi aa yer sowl an wi aa yer mine.’ Thïs ïs tha furst an tha maist impoartin commaun.
second: An tha saicont yin ïs laik ït: ‘Ye maun love yer nighber jist as much as yersel.’ Tha hale o tha Laa an tha Proaphits hing on these twa commauns.”  A question fer tha Pharisees  Noo whaniver tha Pharisees wus gethert roon hïm thair, Jesus axt thaim, “Whut dae ye thïnk aboot tha Messiah?

second: Whase sinn ïs he?” “Tha sinn o Davit,” the' answert.

first: Whase sinn ïs he?” “Tha sinn o Davit,” the' answert.
second: He saed tae thaim, “Then hoo ïs ït that Davit, spakin bi tha Spïrit, caas hïm ‘Loard’?

first: He saed tae thaim, “Then hoo ïs ït that Davit, spakin bi tha Spïrit, caas hïm ‘Loard’?
second: Fer he says,  ‘Tha Loard saed tae ma Loard:  Sït doon at ma richt han,  tae A pit yer enemies unnèr yer feet.’  Sae ïf Davit caas tha Messiah ‘ma Loard’, hoo can he be hïs sinn as weel?” An naebodie haed a wurd tae say bak tae hïm, an frae that day on naebodie wud dar ax hïm onie mair questions.

first: Sae ye maun obey thaim an dae iveriethin the' tell ye.

first: Ye say as weel, ‘If oniebodie sweers bi tha althar, ït mains naethin; but ïf oniebodie sweers bi tha gift on ït, he ïs bun bi hïs oath.’ Ye blin men!

first: Sae then ïf oniebodie tells ye, ‘Thair he ïs, oot ïn tha wuldèrness,’ dïnnae gae oot; or, ‘He's hidin here ïn tha hoose,’ dïnnae believe ït.
second: Fer jist as tha lichtnin fleshes ower tha lïft, frae tha East tae tha Wast, that's whut tha cumin o tha Sinn o Man wull be laik.

first: Fer jist as tha lichtnin fleshes ower tha lïft, frae tha East tae tha Wast, that's whut tha cumin o tha Sinn o Man wull be laik.
second: Whariver ye see a crood o vultèrs, ye know thair's a deid bodie thair.

first: Whariver ye see a crood o vultèrs, ye know thair's a deid bodie thair.

second: The'll see tha Sinn o Man cumin on tha cloods o heiven, wi pooer an muckle glorie.

first: The'll see tha Sinn o Man cumin on tha cloods o heiven, wi pooer an muckle glorie.

first: He'll senn hïs angels oot wi a lood caa o tha trumpet, an the'll gether hïs chosen yins frae tha fower wuns, frae tha yin enn o heiven tae tha tither.
second: Noo, lairn thïs lesson frae tha fïg tree.

first: Noo, lairn thïs lesson frae tha fïg tree.

first: As shuin as ïts brenches stairts tae bud, an ïts leafs cum oot, ye ken tha simmer ïs no faur aff.

first: In tha same wye, whaniver ye see aa these thïngs, ye'll ken tha time ïs nearhan, ay, richt at tha verie dure.

first: A tell ye tha truith, thair's fowks leevin noo that'll no dee, afore aa these thïngs haes cum aboot!

first: Heiven an irth wull pass awa, but ma wurds wull niver pass awa.

first: Whaniver tha Sinn o Man cums bak, ït'll be jist laik ït wus ïn Noah's day.
second: Fer ïn tha days afore tha Flood, fowk wus aitin an drïnkin an gettin merriet, richt up tae tha verie day Noah went ïntae tha airk; an the' kent naethin aboot whut wud happen, til tha Flood cum an tuk thaim al awa.

first: Fer ïn tha days afore tha Flood, fowk wus aitin an drïnkin an gettin merriet, richt up tae tha verie day Noah went ïntae tha airk; an the' kent naethin aboot whut wud happen, til tha Flood cum an tuk thaim al awa.
second: An that's whut ït'll be laik, whaniver tha Sinn o Man cums bak.

first: An that's whut ït'll be laik, whaniver tha Sinn o Man cums bak.

first: Twa weemen wull be grindin mail; yin wull be tuk an tha ither left behin.

first: Sae yous keep watchin tae, fer yis dïnnae ken whut day yer Loard's cumin.
second: Ye can be shair o thïs: ïf ye haed a hoose, an ye knowed whut oor o tha nicht a thief wus cumin, ye'd be watchin fer hïm, wud ye no?

first: Ye can be shair o thïs: ïf ye haed a hoose, an ye knowed whut oor o tha nicht a thief wus cumin, ye'd be watchin fer hïm, wud ye no?
second: An ye wudnae alloo yer hoose tae be brauk ïntae.

first: An ye wudnae alloo yer hoose tae be brauk ïntae.

first: Sae yous maun be readie tae, fer ye dïnnae ken tha oor tha Sinn o Man wull cum.
second: Wha ïs a sarvint ye'd caa faithfu an wise?

first: Wha ïs a sarvint ye'd caa faithfu an wise?
second: Is ït no tha yin that tha maistèr haes püt ïn chairge o tha ither sarvints ïn hïs hoose, tae gie thaim thair fair share o mait at tha richt time?

first: Is ït no tha yin that tha maistèr haes püt ïn chairge o tha ither sarvints ïn hïs hoose, tae gie thaim thair fair share o mait at tha richt time?
second: Whaniver hïs maistèr cums bak, onie sarvint ectin laik thïs wull be a happie man.

first: Whaniver hïs maistèr cums bak, onie sarvint ectin laik thïs wull be a happie man.

first: A tell ye tha truith, he'll pit that sarvint ïn chairge o iveriethin he haes.

first: But jist say that sarvint ïs wïckit an says tae hissel, ‘He's a lang time o cumin, tha maistèr,’ an he stairts tae bate up hïs fella sarvints an tae ait an collogue wi thaim that's fand o tha drïnk; Weel, tha maistèr o that sarvint wull cum bak on a day an oor whan tha sarvint ïsnae lukkin oot fer hïm.

second: Five o thaim wus wutless, an five o thaim wus wise.

first: Five o thaim wus wutless, an five o thaim wus wise.
second: Tha yins wi nae wut tuk thair lamps but dïdnae tak eneuch oiyle alang wi thaim.

first: Tha yins wi nae wut tuk thair lamps but dïdnae tak eneuch oiyle alang wi thaim.

first: Tha wise yins but, they tuk jars o oiyle alang wi thair lamps.

second: Tae tha yin he gien five baags o siller, tae anither twa baags, an tae anither jist tha yin baag, accoardin tae whut he knowed the' cud dae wi ït.

first: Tae tha yin he gien five baags o siller, tae anither twa baags, an tae anither jist tha yin baag, accoardin tae whut he knowed the' cud dae wi ït.

first: Then aff he went on hïs thrip.

first: Strecht awa, tha sarvint that got tha five baags begun tae püt hïs siller tae wark, an he got bak five mair.

first: An tha yin wi tha twa baags got twa mair bak as weel.

first: Maistèr,’ he saed, ‘ye hannit ower five baags tae me.

second: Afore hïm aa tha nations wull be gethert thegither, an he'll set apairt tha fowk yin frae tha ither, jist laik a shepherd sets apairt tha sheep frae tha gaits.

first: Afore hïm aa tha nations wull be gethert thegither, an he'll set apairt tha fowk yin frae tha ither, jist laik a shepherd sets apairt tha sheep frae tha gaits.
second: He wull pit tha sheep on hïs richt han an tha gaits on hïs left.

first: He wull pit tha sheep on hïs richt han an tha gaits on hïs left.
second: Then tha Kïng wull say tae tha yins on hïs richt han, ‘Cum, yous that ir blisst bi ma Faither; tak houl o yer inheritance, tha Kïngdom makkit readie fer ye frae tha time tha warl begun.

first: Then tha Kïng wull say tae tha yins on hïs richt han, ‘Cum, yous that ir blisst bi ma Faither; tak houl o yer inheritance, tha Kïngdom makkit readie fer ye frae tha time tha warl begun.
second: Fer A wus hung'rie an ye fed me; A haed a druith on me, an ye gien me sumthin tae drïnk; A wus an ootsider an ye tuk me ïn; A haednae a dud o claes tae ma bak, an ye gien me some; A wus seeck an ye lukt eftèr me; A wus ïn jail an ye cum an vïsitit me.’ Then tha righteous fowk wull say bak tae hïm, ‘Loard, whan wus ït we saa ye hung'rie an gien ye mait, or wi a druith on ye, an gien ye a drïnk?

first: Fer A wus hung'rie an ye fed me; A haed a druith on me, an ye gien me sumthin tae drïnk; A wus an ootsider an ye tuk me ïn; A haednae a dud o claes tae ma bak, an ye gien me some; A wus seeck an ye lukt eftèr me; A wus ïn jail an ye cum an vïsitit me.’ Then tha righteous fowk wull say bak tae hïm, ‘Loard, whan wus ït we saa ye hung'rie an gien ye mait, or wi a druith on ye, an gien ye a drïnk?
second: Whan wus ït we saa ye an ootsider an tuk ye ïn, or wioot a dud an we gien ye some claes?

first: Whan wus ït we saa ye an ootsider an tuk ye ïn, or wioot a dud an we gien ye some claes?
second: Whan dïd we see ye seeck or ïn jail, an went an vïsitit ye?’ Tha Kïng wull answer, ‘A tell ye tha truith, whutiver ye daen fer yin o tha laist impoartin o these brithers o mine, ye daen ït fer me.’ An then he'll say tae tha yins on hïs left han, ‘Awa wi ye, yous that ir curst, awa ïntae tha iverlastin fire that's readie an waitin fer tha Deil an hïs angels!

first: Whan dïd we see ye seeck or ïn jail, an went an vïsitit ye?’ Tha Kïng wull answer, ‘A tell ye tha truith, whutiver ye daen fer yin o tha laist impoartin o these brithers o mine, ye daen ït fer me.’ An then he'll say tae tha yins on hïs left han, ‘Awa wi ye, yous that ir curst, awa ïntae tha iverlastin fire that's readie an waitin fer tha Deil an hïs angels!
second: Tha ploat tae dae awa wi Jesus  Whaniver Jesus haed daen sayin aa these thïngs, he saed tae hïs follaers, “Ye ken tha Passower ïs tha day eftèr themorra, an tha Sinn o Man wull be hannit ower fer tae be nailt tae a cross.”  Then tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs o tha fowk gethert thegither ïn tha palace o tha Heich Preesht, a man bi tha name o Caiaphas, an the' cumpluthèrt fer tae git tha houl o Jesus bi some sleekit wye, an pit hïm tae deith.

first: Tha ploat tae dae awa wi Jesus  Whaniver Jesus haed daen sayin aa these thïngs, he saed tae hïs follaers, “Ye ken tha Passower ïs tha day eftèr themorra, an tha Sinn o Man wull be hannit ower fer tae be nailt tae a cross.”  Then tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs o tha fowk gethert thegither ïn tha palace o tha Heich Preesht, a man bi tha name o Caiaphas, an the' cumpluthèrt fer tae git tha houl o Jesus bi some sleekit wye, an pit hïm tae deith.
second: But no whan tha Faist's on,” the' saed, “or we'll hae a garevitch on oor hans!”  Tha wee crock o scent  Aa tha while, Jesus wus ïn Bethanie ïn tha hoose o Simon tha Leper, an a wumman cum up tae hïm wi a wee crock o scent - perfume that wus wile dear - that she poored ower hïs heid as he wus restin at tha boord.

first: But no whan tha Faist's on,” the' saed, “or we'll hae a garevitch on oor hans!”  Tha wee crock o scent  Aa tha while, Jesus wus ïn Bethanie ïn tha hoose o Simon tha Leper, an a wumman cum up tae hïm wi a wee crock o scent - perfume that wus wile dear - that she poored ower hïs heid as he wus restin at tha boord.
second: But whaniver tha follaers saen thïs, the' wur wile ang'rie.

first: But whaniver tha follaers saen thïs, the' wur wile ang'rie.
second: Why thïs waste?” the' axt.

first: Why thïs waste?” the' axt.
second: Thïs perfume cud hae bin soul fer a bïg price, an tha siller gien tae tha puir.” Knowin weel whut the' wur sayin, Jesus saed tae thaim, “Dïnnae bother tha wumman!

first: Thïs perfume cud hae bin soul fer a bïg price, an tha siller gien tae tha puir.” Knowin weel whut the' wur sayin, Jesus saed tae thaim, “Dïnnae bother tha wumman!
second: Thïs ïs a guid thïng she haes daen fer me.

first: Thïs ïs a guid thïng she haes daen fer me.
second: Fer ye'll aye hae tha puir wi yis, but ye'll no aye hae me.

first: Fer ye'll aye hae tha puir wi yis, but ye'll no aye hae me.
second: Whaniver she poored thïs perfume on ma bodie, she daen ït fer tae mak me readie fer ma buryin.

first: Then Pilate axt hïm, “Dae ye no hear whut the'r chairgin ye wi?” But Jesus niver saed a wurd bak tae hïm regairdin onie o tha chairges agin hïm, an tha Guviner wus stoondit.
second: Noo ït uist tae be at tha Passower Faist, tha Guviner wud aye let a prisner oot o jail: whutiver yin tha fowk axt fer.

first: Noo ït uist tae be at tha Passower Faist, tha Guviner wud aye let a prisner oot o jail: whutiver yin tha fowk axt fer.
second: An that year the' haed a prisner iveriebodie haed heerd tell o, bi tha name o Barabbas.

first: An that year the' haed a prisner iveriebodie haed heerd tell o, bi tha name o Barabbas.
second: Sae whaniver tha crood haed gethert thegither, Pilate axt thaim, “Whutch yin dae yis want me tae let oot tae ye: Barabbas, or Jesus, that ïs caad Christ?” Fer he knowed richt weel ït wus jist oot o spite the' haed hannit Jesus ower tae hïm.

first: Sae whaniver tha crood haed gethert thegither, Pilate axt thaim, “Whutch yin dae yis want me tae let oot tae ye: Barabbas, or Jesus, that ïs caad Christ?” Fer he knowed richt weel ït wus jist oot o spite the' haed hannit Jesus ower tae hïm.
second: Noo as Pilate wus sïttin on tha judge's sait, hïs wife sent hïm thïs message: “Hae naethin tae dae wi thon innocent man, fer A'm tellin ye, A'm sair tormentit thïs day bi a draim A haed aboot hïm!” But tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs taakt tha crood roon, sae as the' wud ax fer Barabbas an hae Jesus püt tae deith.

first: Noo as Pilate wus sïttin on tha judge's sait, hïs wife sent hïm thïs message: “Hae naethin tae dae wi thon innocent man, fer A'm tellin ye, A'm sair tormentit thïs day bi a draim A haed aboot hïm!” But tha heid preeshts an tha eldèrs taakt tha crood roon, sae as the' wud ax fer Barabbas an hae Jesus püt tae deith.
second: Whutch o tha twa dae yis want me tae let oot tae yis then?” axt tha Guviner.

first: Whutch o tha twa dae yis want me tae let oot tae yis then?” axt tha Guviner.
second: We want Barabbas!” the' answert.

first: We want Barabbas!” the' answert.
second: Sae whut am A tae dae wi Jesus that's caad tha Christ?” Pilate axt.

first: Sae whut am A tae dae wi Jesus that's caad tha Christ?” Pilate axt.
second: An the' aa saed bak, “Tae tha cross wi hïm!” “But whut fer?

first: An the' aa saed bak, “Tae tha cross wi hïm!” “But whut fer?
second: Whut's he daen wrang?” axt Pilate.

first: Whut's he daen wrang?” axt Pilate.
second: But tha thrang jist roared aa tha mair, “Tae tha cross wi hïm!”  Whaniver Pilate saen that he wus gettin naewhar, but that he wus aboot tae hae a riot on hïs hans, he got some wattèr an waasht hïs hans afore tha crood o fowk.

first: But tha thrang jist roared aa tha mair, “Tae tha cross wi hïm!”  Whaniver Pilate saen that he wus gettin naewhar, but that he wus aboot tae hae a riot on hïs hans, he got some wattèr an waasht hïs hans afore tha crood o fowk.
second: A'm no guiltie o thïs man's bluid,” saed he.

first: A'm no guiltie o thïs man's bluid,” saed he.
second: On your heids be ït!” Aa tha fowk saed, “Let hïs bluid be on us an on oor childèr!” Then he lut Barabbas oot tae thaim.

first: On your heids be ït!” Aa tha fowk saed, “Let hïs bluid be on us an on oor childèr!” Then he lut Barabbas oot tae thaim.
second: But he got Jesus whuppt, an he hannit hïm ower fer tae be crucyfied.

first: But he got Jesus whuppt, an he hannit hïm ower fer tae be crucyfied.
second: Tha sodgers mock Jesus  Then tha Guviner's sodgers tuk Jesus ïntae tha Praetorium an the' gethert tha hale regiment roon hïm.

first: Tha sodgers mock Jesus  Then tha Guviner's sodgers tuk Jesus ïntae tha Praetorium an the' gethert tha hale regiment roon hïm.
second: The' strïpt hïm an püt a scarlet robe on hïm, an then the' plettit thoarns thegither tae mak a croon, an the' set ït on hïs heid.

first: The' strïpt hïm an püt a scarlet robe on hïm, an then the' plettit thoarns thegither tae mak a croon, an the' set ït on hïs heid.
second: The' püt a stav ïn hïs richt han an the' got doon on thair knees afore hïm, mockin hïm an sayin, “Lang leeve tha Kïng o tha Jews!” The' sput on hïm, an the' tuk tha stav an hut hïm ower tha heid agane an agane.

first: The' püt a stav ïn hïs richt han an the' got doon on thair knees afore hïm, mockin hïm an sayin, “Lang leeve tha Kïng o tha Jews!” The' sput on hïm, an the' tuk tha stav an hut hïm ower tha heid agane an agane.
second: An eftèr the' haed daen mockin hïm, the' tuk tha robe aff hïm, an the' püt hïs ain claes bak on hïm.

first: An eftèr the' haed daen mockin hïm, the' tuk tha robe aff hïm, an the' püt hïs ain claes bak on hïm.
second: Then the' tuk hïm awa fer tae crucyfie hïm.

first: Then the' tuk hïm awa fer tae crucyfie hïm.
second: Tha crucyfixion  An whaniver the' wur on thair wye oot, the' run ïntae a man frae Cyrene, bi tha name o Simon, an the' gart hïm tae cairrie tha cross.

first: Tha crucyfixion  An whaniver the' wur on thair wye oot, the' run ïntae a man frae Cyrene, bi tha name o Simon, an the' gart hïm tae cairrie tha cross.
second: The' cum tae a place caad Golgotha (mainin “Tha Place o tha Skull”).

first: The' cum tae a place caad Golgotha (mainin “Tha Place o tha Skull”).
second: Thair the' raxt wine up tae Jesus, mixt wi gall; but eftèr tastin ït, he wudnae drïnk onie mair.

first: Thair the' raxt wine up tae Jesus, mixt wi gall; but eftèr tastin ït, he wudnae drïnk onie mair.
second: Noo whaniver tha sodgers haed nailt hïm tae tha cross, the' gemmelt amang thairsels tae dïvide hïs claes.

first: Noo whaniver tha sodgers haed nailt hïm tae tha cross, the' gemmelt amang thairsels tae dïvide hïs claes.
second: Thïs brocht aboot whut tha proaphit saed wud happen:  “The' dïvïd ma dishables amang thaim  an the' cloddit dice fer ma claes.”]  An sïttin doon, the' kep watch ower hïm thair.

first: Thïs brocht aboot whut tha proaphit saed wud happen:  “The' dïvïd ma dishables amang thaim  an the' cloddit dice fer ma claes.”]  An sïttin doon, the' kep watch ower hïm thair.
second: Abain hïs heid the' püt up tha chairge agin hïm, that saed: THIS IS JESUS, THA KING O THA JEWS.

first: Abain hïs heid the' püt up tha chairge agin hïm, that saed: THIS IS JESUS, THA KING O THA JEWS.
second: Twa robbers wur crucyfied alang wi hïm, yin on hïs richt han side, an tha tither on hïs left.

first: Twa robbers wur crucyfied alang wi hïm, yin on hïs richt han side, an tha tither on hïs left.
second: Thaim at waakt bye yellt abuse at hïm, shakin thair heids, an sayin, “Hey, you that saed ye wur gaun tae desthroy tha Hoose o God, an big ït agane ïn thrie days - save yersel!

first: Thaim at waakt bye yellt abuse at hïm, shakin thair heids, an sayin, “Hey, you that saed ye wur gaun tae desthroy tha Hoose o God, an big ït agane ïn thrie days - save yersel!
second: If you ir tha Sinn o God, cum doon aff that cross!” An tha heid preeshts, tha maistèrs o tha Laa an tha eldèrs, the' daen tha same, an the' mockt hïm.

first: If you ir tha Sinn o God, cum doon aff that cross!” An tha heid preeshts, tha maistèrs o tha Laa an tha eldèrs, the' daen tha same, an the' mockt hïm.
second: He saved ithers,” the' saed, “but he cannae save hissel!

first: He saved ithers,” the' saed, “but he cannae save hissel!
second: Is he no tha Kïng o Israel?

first: Is he no tha Kïng o Israel?
second: Then jist let hïm cum doon aff tha cross, an we'll believe ïn hïm!

first: Then jist let hïm cum doon aff tha cross, an we'll believe ïn hïm!
second: He trusts ïn God.

first: He trusts ïn God.
second: Let God rescue hïm noo ïf he wants hïm, fer he saed, ‘A be tha Sinn o God.’ ” Tha robbers that wur crucyfied wi hïm hurlt abuse at hïm as weel.

first: Let God rescue hïm noo ïf he wants hïm, fer he saed, ‘A be tha Sinn o God.’ ” Tha robbers that wur crucyfied wi hïm hurlt abuse at hïm as weel.
second: Tha deith o Jesus  Frae nuin tae thrie ïn tha eftèrnuin, dairkness cum ower tha hale lan.

first: Tha deith o Jesus  Frae nuin tae thrie ïn tha eftèrnuin, dairkness cum ower tha hale lan.
second: An roon aboot thrie Jesus caad oot wi a lood voice, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” - that mains: “O God, ma God, why hae ye forsook me?” Whaniver some o thaim stannin bye heerd thïs, the' saed, “He's caain oot fer Elijah.” An richt awa yin o thaim run an got a sponge.

first: An roon aboot thrie Jesus caad oot wi a lood voice, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” - that mains: “O God, ma God, why hae ye forsook me?” Whaniver some o thaim stannin bye heerd thïs, the' saed, “He's caain oot fer Elijah.” An richt awa yin o thaim run an got a sponge.
second: He fïllt ït wi soor wine, püt ït on a lang stïck, an raxt ït up tae Jesus fer hïm tae drïnk.

first: He fïllt ït wi soor wine, püt ït on a lang stïck, an raxt ït up tae Jesus fer hïm tae drïnk.
second: But tha ithers saed, “Jist lea hïm alane.

first: But tha ithers saed, “Jist lea hïm alane.
second: We'll see noo ïf Elijah cums fer tae save hïm.” Then Jesus cryed oot agane wi a lood voice, an he gien up hïs spïrit.

first: We'll see noo ïf Elijah cums fer tae save hïm.” Then Jesus cryed oot agane wi a lood voice, an he gien up hïs spïrit.
second: At that verie mïnit tha curtin ïn tha Halie o Halies wus tore ïn twa frae tap tae bottom.

first: At that verie mïnit tha curtin ïn tha Halie o Halies wus tore ïn twa frae tap tae bottom.
second: Tha irth shuk an tha roaks splït.

first: Tha irth shuk an tha roaks splït.
second: Tha graves apent, an tha bodies o monie halie fowk that haed deed wur ris tae life.

first: Tha graves apent, an tha bodies o monie halie fowk that haed deed wur ris tae life.
second: The' cum oot o thair tombs, an eftèr Jesus wus ris frae tha deid the' went ïntae tha halie cïtie an appeart tae a lock o fowk.

first: The' cum oot o thair tombs, an eftèr Jesus wus ris frae tha deid the' went ïntae tha halie cïtie an appeart tae a lock o fowk.
second: Tha centurion an thaim alang wi hïm that wus gairdin Jesus, whaniver the' saa tha irthquake an aa that haed happent, the' wur hairt-scarred, an the' saed, “Thair can be nae doot, thïs wus tha Sinn o God!”  Noo monie weemen wur thair as weel, stannin awa bak takkin ït aa ïn.

first: Tha centurion an thaim alang wi hïm that wus gairdin Jesus, whaniver the' saa tha irthquake an aa that haed happent, the' wur hairt-scarred, an the' saed, “Thair can be nae doot, thïs wus tha Sinn o God!”  Noo monie weemen wur thair as weel, stannin awa bak takkin ït aa ïn.
second: The' haed follaed Jesus frae Galilee fer tae luk eftèr hïm.

first: The' haed follaed Jesus frae Galilee fer tae luk eftèr hïm.
second: In amang thaim thair wus Mary Magdalene, an Mary tha mither o Jeames an Joses, an thair wus tha mither o Zebedee's sinns.

first: In amang thaim thair wus Mary Magdalene, an Mary tha mither o Jeames an Joses, an thair wus tha mither o Zebedee's sinns.
second: Jesus ïs buriet  Whan ït cum evenin, thair wus thïs weel-aff man frae Arimathea, bi tha name o Joseph, wha hissel haed becum a follaer o Jesus.

first: Jesus ïs buriet  Whan ït cum evenin, thair wus thïs weel-aff man frae Arimathea, bi tha name o Joseph, wha hissel haed becum a follaer o Jesus.
second: An he gan tae Pilate, an he axt fer tha bodie o Jesus, an Pilate oardèrt thaim tae gie ït tae hïm.

first: An he gan tae Pilate, an he axt fer tha bodie o Jesus, an Pilate oardèrt thaim tae gie ït tae hïm.
second: Joseph tuk tha bodie, an he lapt ït ïn a clain lïnen claith, an he layed ït ïn hïs ain new tomb he haed cut oot o tha roak.

first: Joseph tuk tha bodie, an he lapt ït ïn a clain lïnen claith, an he layed ït ïn hïs ain new tomb he haed cut oot o tha roak.
second: He rowlt a bïg stane agin tha mooth o tha tomb an then he gaed awa.

first: He rowlt a bïg stane agin tha mooth o tha tomb an then he gaed awa.
second: Mary Magdalene an tha ither Mary wur sïttin thair fornent tha tomb.

first: Mary Magdalene an tha ither Mary wur sïttin thair fornent tha tomb.
second: Tha gaird on tha tomb  Tha nixt day, tha yin eftèr tha Day o Preparation, tha heid preeshts an tha Pharisees went tae Pilate.

first: Tha gaird on tha tomb  Tha nixt day, tha yin eftèr tha Day o Preparation, tha heid preeshts an tha Pharisees went tae Pilate.
second: Sïr,” the' saed, “whaniver that deceiver wus still leevin, we mine hïm sayin, ‘Eftèr thrie days A wull rise agane.’ Sae wud ye gie tha oardèr fer thaim tae shut that tomb weel tae tha thurd day, less hïs follaers cum an steal tha bodie an tell tha fowk he haes ris frae tha deid.

first: Sïr,” the' saed, “whaniver that deceiver wus still leevin, we mine hïm sayin, ‘Eftèr thrie days A wull rise agane.’ Sae wud ye gie tha oardèr fer thaim tae shut that tomb weel tae tha thurd day, less hïs follaers cum an steal tha bodie an tell tha fowk he haes ris frae tha deid.
second: Then that deception wud be waur ner tha furst.” “Tak gairds wi ye,” saed Pilate.

first: Then that deception wud be waur ner tha furst.” “Tak gairds wi ye,” saed Pilate.
second: Awa an shut up tha tomb as weel as ye can.” Sae the' gaed an made tha tomb safe bi sealin tha stane an leain tha gaird tae keep watch.

first: Awa an shut up tha tomb as weel as ye can.” Sae the' gaed an made tha tomb safe bi sealin tha stane an leain tha gaird tae keep watch.
second: Tha empie tomb  It wus eftèr tha Sabbath, at daylicht on tha furst day o tha week, an Mary Magdalene an tha ither Mary cum tae luk at tha tomb.

first: Tha empie tomb  It wus eftèr tha Sabbath, at daylicht on tha furst day o tha week, an Mary Magdalene an tha ither Mary cum tae luk at tha tomb.
second: Aa o a suddent, thair wus a michtie irthquake, fer an angel o tha Loard cum doon frae heiven!

first: Aa o a suddent, thair wus a michtie irthquake, fer an angel o tha Loard cum doon frae heiven!
second: He gaed tae tha tomb, an he rowlt bak tha stane an he sut on ït.

first: He gaed tae tha tomb, an he rowlt bak tha stane an he sut on ït.
second: He wus bricht as lichtnin, an hïs claes wus white as snaa.

first: He wus bricht as lichtnin, an hïs claes wus white as snaa.
second: Whaniver the' saa hïm, tha gairds at tha tomb shuk wi fear an the' becum laik deid men.

first: Whaniver the' saa hïm, tha gairds at tha tomb shuk wi fear an the' becum laik deid men.
second: But tha angel saed tae tha weemen, “Dïnnae be feart, fer A ken that ye'r lukkin fer Jesus, that wus crucyfied.

first: But tha angel saed tae tha weemen, “Dïnnae be feart, fer A ken that ye'r lukkin fer Jesus, that wus crucyfied.
second: He's no here; he's ris, jist as he saed he wud.

first: He's no here; he's ris, jist as he saed he wud.
second: Cum an see tha place whar he wus layed oot.

first: Cum an see tha place whar he wus layed oot.
second: Quïck!

first: Quïck!
second: Gae an tell hïs follaers, ‘He haes ris frae tha deid an he's awa on aheid o ye ïntae Galilee.

first: Gae an tell hïs follaers, ‘He haes ris frae tha deid an he's awa on aheid o ye ïntae Galilee.
second: Ye'll see hïm thair.’ Noo mine whut A hae toul ye.” Sae tha weemen hurriet frae tha tomb; the' wur afeart, yit fu o joy.

first: Ye'll see hïm thair.’ Noo mine whut A hae toul ye.” Sae tha weemen hurriet frae tha tomb; the' wur afeart, yit fu o joy.
second: The' run tae tell hïs follaers, whan aa o a suddent Jesus appeart fornent thaim.

first: The' run tae tell hïs follaers, whan aa o a suddent Jesus appeart fornent thaim.
second: Fair faa ye!” saed he.

first: Fair faa ye!” saed he.
second: An the' went tae hïm, tuk houl o hïs feet an wurshipt hïm.

first: An the' went tae hïm, tuk houl o hïs feet an wurshipt hïm.
second: Then Jesus saed tae thaim, “Dïnnae be feart.

first: Then Jesus saed tae thaim, “Dïnnae be feart.
second: Gae an tell ma brithers tae gae ïntae Galilee, an the'll see me thair.”  Tha storie tha gairds püt roon  While tha weemen wur on thair wye, some o tha gairds went ïntae tha cïtie an toul tha heid preeshts aa that haed cum aboot.

first: Gae an tell ma brithers tae gae ïntae Galilee, an the'll see me thair.”  Tha storie tha gairds püt roon  While tha weemen wur on thair wye, some o tha gairds went ïntae tha cïtie an toul tha heid preeshts aa that haed cum aboot.
second: An whaniver tha heid preeshts haed gethert thegither wi tha eldèrs, the' collogued amang thairsels, an the' gien tha sodgers a bïg amoont o siller, an the' toul thaim, “Ye'r tae say, ‘Tha follaers o Jesus cum ïn tha nicht an stole hïm awa whan we wur sleepin.’ If tha Guviner hears tell o thïs, we'll taak hïm roon, an keep ye oot o bother.” Sae tha sodgers tuk tha siller an daen as the' wur toul.

first: An whaniver tha heid preeshts haed gethert thegither wi tha eldèrs, the' collogued amang thairsels, an the' gien tha sodgers a bïg amoont o siller, an the' toul thaim, “Ye'r tae say, ‘Tha follaers o Jesus cum ïn tha nicht an stole hïm awa whan we wur sleepin.’ If tha Guviner hears tell o thïs, we'll taak hïm roon, an keep ye oot o bother.” Sae tha sodgers tuk tha siller an daen as the' wur toul.
second: An thïs storie haes gan roon amang tha Jews tae thïs verie day.

first: An thïs storie haes gan roon amang tha Jews tae thïs verie day.
second: Jesus senns oot hïs follaers  Then tha eleiven follaers gaed tae Galilee, tae tha muntin whar Jesus haed toul thaim.

first: Jesus senns oot hïs follaers  Then tha eleiven follaers gaed tae Galilee, tae tha muntin whar Jesus haed toul thaim.
second: Whaniver the' saen hïm, the' wurshipt hïm; but some aye haed thair doots.

first: Whaniver the' saen hïm, the' wurshipt hïm; but some aye haed thair doots.
second: Then Jesus cum tae thaim an saed, “Aa thortie haes bin gien tae me ïn heiven an on irth.

first: Then Jesus cum tae thaim an saed, “Aa thortie haes bin gien tae me ïn heiven an on irth.
second: Sae gang an mak follaers o aa nations, baptisin thaim ïn tha name o tha Faither an o tha Sinn an o tha Halie Spïrit, taichin thaim tae keep aa tha commauns A hae gien ye.

first: Sae gang an mak follaers o aa nations, baptisin thaim ïn tha name o tha Faither an o tha Sinn an o tha Halie Spïrit, taichin thaim tae keep aa tha commauns A hae gien ye.
second: An know thïs: A be wi ye iverie day, ay, tae tha verie enn o time.”
